Date


Title


Description






Jun 14, 2024


Intimate Partner Violence During COVID-19


A data visualization project analyzing the impact of ethnocultural influences and external support systems on intimate partner violence during the COVID-19 pandemic, using survey data to uncover trends and disparities. 




Jun 14, 2024


Boost or Rest: How Caffeine and Sleep Influence Problem-Solving


A statistical analysis project exploring the effects of caffeine intake and nap duration on problem-solving abilities using a Two-Way Randomized Block Design. The study utilizes ANOVA, TukeyHSD, and data visualization techniques to assess cognitive performance outcomes.




Mar 22, 2024


Estimating Implied Volatility of Call Options Using Newton-Raphson and the Black-Scholes Model


A mathematical and computational project implementing the Newton-Raphson method to approximate implied volatility in call options pricing.





No matching items

title: About Me
text:
Los Angeles, CA | Sept 2021 - June 2025
Bachelor of Science in Statistics & Data Science
Bachelor of Science in Mathematics of Computation








Statistics & Data Science






Statistical Modeling: Intro to Probability (MATH 170E), Intro to Statistics (MATH 170S), Linear Models (STATS 100C)

Machine Learning & Data Analysis: Intro Data Analysis & Regression (STATS 101A), Intermediate Regression & Data Mining (STATS 101C), Statistical Consulting (STATS 140XP, STATS 141XP)

Computational Methods: Intro to Computational Statistics (STATS 102A), Monte Carlo Methods (STATS 102C), Applied Numerical Methods (MATH 151A, MATH 151B)

Mathematical Foundations for Data Science: Mathematical Methods of Data Theory (MATH 118)
Specialized Topics: Intro to Computing & Optimization (STATS 102B), Design & Analysis of Experiments (STATS 101B)










Mathematics of Computation






Linear Algebra & Optimization: Linear Algebra (MATH 115A), Optimization (MATH 164)

Analysis & Differential Equations: Real Analysis (MATH 131A), Differential Equations (MATH 33B)
Complex Analysis & Applications: Complex Analysis & Applications (MATH 132)










Computer Science & Programming






Core Programming: Programming with R (STATS 20), Intro to Python for Data Science (STATS 21), Advanced Programming (COMPTNG 10C)

Systems & Computational Methods: Intro to Computer Science (COM SCI 31, COM SCI 32), Data Science (COM SCI M148)

Algorithms & Complexity: Algorithms & Complexity (COM SCI 180)

title: About Me
text:
Experience

Undergraduate Learning Assistant, UCLA Undergraduate Learning Assistant Program
03/2024 - 06/2024

Supported two sections of Physics 1A: Mechanics (~70+ students) in weekly discussions, answering worksheet-related and conceptual questions.
Collaborated with instructors and TAs in weekly meetings to discuss course material and instructional strategies.
Applied active learning techniques such as redirecting questions, fostering collaboration, and using open-ended inquiry.
Revised instructional strategies based on student feedback to improve engagement and comprehension.



Bruin Women in Business
10/2022 - Present

Event Committee Logistic Manager | 03/2024 - 11/2024

Lead logistical coordination for the Aspiring Businesswomen Summit 2024, an all-day professional development event for high school students in Los Angeles.

Oversaw event planning, including venue selection, catering, registration, and scheduling.
Managed communication with event speakers and participants to ensure their engagement and attendance.



Event Committee Member | 03/2023 - 11/2023

Developed and implemented logistical plans for the 2023 Aspiring Businesswomen Summit.

Managed venue selection, catering, registration, and scheduling to ensure seamless event execution.

Participated in brainstorming sessions** to generate **innovative ideas for the summitâ€™s agenda and activities.

Provided on-site support, addressing attendee inquiries, managing registration, and facilitating session transitions.



General Member | 10/2022 - 09/2023

Participated in professional development workshops, speaker panels, and networking events.
Engaged with club activities and volunteered for event setup and execution.




Secretary, Community Improvement Service
10/2017 - 08/2021

Managed a membership of 100+ individuals and facilitated communication between members, officers, and the community
Collaborated with organizations such as Self-Help for the Elderly and SFPCI (Pathways to Citizenship) to plan and execute volunteer events, building strong relationships and expanding the reach of our community service initiatives
Facilitated the distribution of volunteer opportunities to members and tracked their participation to ensure engagement and accountability
Hosted and led weekly officer meetings and member meetings to discuss progress, plan new initiatives, and address challenges



Co-founder/Officer, CIS Tutoring Program
09/2020 - 08/2021

Co-founded and led a tutoring program during the pandemic to support children struggling with remote learning.
Recruited and trained a team of high school tutors to provide one-on-one or small group tutoring in math, English, and other subjects.



Intern/School Lead, Teen HEAL
08/2019 - 08/2020

Led the development and execution of a Healthy Appetite Club at Balboa High School to empower members to improve their nutritional and physical well-being.
Utilized skills in program planning, curriculum development, and goal setting.
Demonstrated strong communication by collaborating with other HEAL interns from five high schools, reaching over 150 teens through club meetings, community events, and training.

title: Zhuowei Deng
text:
Hi, Iâ€™m Zhuowei Deng, a senior at UCLA, majoring in Statistics & Data Science and Mathematics of Computation. I have a strong passion for data science, machine learning, and statistical modeling, and I am always eager to explore how data can be used to solve real-world problems.
I was born and raised in China before immigrating to the United States at 12, where my family settled in San Francisco. Throughout middle and high school, mathematics was always my favorite subject, but it wasnâ€™t until I took AP Statistics that I discovered my passion for uncovering patterns and insights through data. Fascinated by how statistics transforms raw data into meaningful information for informed decision-making, I decided to pursue a double major at UCLA, integrating computer science to further enhance my analytical skills.
At UCLA, I work as an Undergraduate Learning Assistant for Physics 1A: Mechanics, where I support two discussion sections (~60+ students) by answering questions and guiding problem-solving during worksheets. I meet weekly with TAs to review materials and ensure discussions are structured for effective student engagement. This experience has strengthened my teaching, communication, and problem-solving skills. I also serve as an Event Committee Logistics Manager for Bruin Women in Business (BWIB), helping coordinate event logistics and outreach for professional networking events such as the Aspiring Businesswomen Summit.
Outside of my studies, I love traveling and exploring new cuisinesâ€”Thai food is my favorite! I also have a passion for movies, and my all-time favorite film is The Shawshank Redemption.
